fields.body:
Create an Article Outline about New York City

The Carnegie Mellon Social Computing Laboratory is conducting research to study how people write articles on the internet. Imagine that you are planning to write an article about New York City. Please create an outline for this article in the form below.

Rules

  • Please write one topic per line in the order that you think it should appear in the article.
  • Please provide 4 to 8 outline headings.

Example

For example, an article on Lions might have the following outline:

  1. Biological classification
  2. Physical characteristics
  3. Biology and behavior
  4. Distribution and habitat
  5. Population and conservation status
  6. Cultural depictions

Outline
fields.description: Imagine that you are planning to write an article about New York City. Please create an outline for this article in the form below
fields.title: Create an Article Outline about New York City

fields.body:
Collect one fact about the %(topic)s of New York City

The Carnegie Mellon Social Computing Laboratory is conducting research to study how people write articles on the internet. Imagine that you are researching the %(topic)s of New York City. Please provide one fact about this topic.

Rules

  • Please ensure that the fact you provide is true.
  • Please write your fact in one complete sentence.
  • Please provide a reference URL for your data.

Example

For example, some facts about the physical characteristics of lions are:

  • The mane of the adult male lion, unique among cats, is one of the most distinctive characteristics of the species. -- http://www.lionlamb.us/lion/lionfact.html
  • Weights for adult lions range between 150–250 kg for males and 120–182 kg for females. -- http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2006/04/060414003130.htm
  • Lion coloration varies from light buff to yellowish, reddish, or dark brown. -- http://www.blogcatalog.com/blog/picture-of-cats-blog/fa2e2b20cc2531393fb52d1f8ae26f74

Outline

Fact sentence:

Reference URL:
fields.description: Imagine that you are researching the %(topic)s of New York City. Please provide one fact about this topic.
fields.title: Collect one fact about the %(topic)s of New York City

fields.body:
Write a paragraph out of some facts

Rules

  • Please write in complete sentences with good spelling and grammar.
  • Please include all of the facts in your paragraph

Example

For example, given the following facts:

  • it's really hard to start a new company
  • there are a variety of ways to fund a new company, but none of them really depend on the quality of the idea
  • many companies are funded by personal funds or family investments. this becomes a test of your relationships, or your personal savings
  • angel investors test how well you can deliver convincing pitches

you might merge them into a paragraph as follows:

There are a variety of ways to fund a startup company, but none of them directly depend on the significance of the idea. Many founders rely on personal savings to fund their company, which heavily taxes their bank account. In other cases, friends and family may help, but this taxes relationships in the founder’s personal life. When dealing with Angel investors, a successful “elevator pitch” and your relationship with the Angel investor determines funding success.

Paragraph

Given the following facts:

    %(list)s

Please provide your combined paragraph in the textarea below:
fields.description: Write a short paragraph that talks about this set of facts.
fields.title: Write a short paragraph from some facts

fields.body:
Come up with a list of car makes and models

Imagine that you're looking to buy a car for your young, suburban family. You and your spouse have two children that you drive to school on a daily basis. Also, you enjoy spending vacation time going camping on family road trips. Please provide a list of car makes and models (from 2010) that you would examine to decide which car to buy.

Rules

  • Please provide car make and model.
  • Please provide 4 to 8 candidates.

Example

For example, a computer gamer looking for a new laptop might be interested in studying the following models:

  1. Alienware - M17x
  2. Alienware - M15x
  3. AVADirect - Clevo M980NU
  4. iBuypower - Battalion Touch CZ-10
  5. Eurocom - D900F Panther

Candidates

Please provide your answers in the form below:
fields.description: Imagine that you're looking to buy a car for a young, suburban family. Please provide 4 to 8 models that you would examine to make your decision
fields.title: Come up with a list of car makes and models

fields.body:
Come up with criteria for buying a new car

Imagine that you're looking to buy a car for your young, suburban family. You and your spouse have two children that you drive to school on a daily basis. Also, you enjoy spending vacation time going camping on family road trips. Please provide some things that you care about when looking for your new vehicle.

Rules

  • Please write one criteria per line in order of importance.
  • Please provide 4 to 8 criteria.

Example

For example, important criteria in selecting a laptop computer for a gamer on a budget might be:

  1. Price
  2. Graphics performance
  3. Screen quality and size
  4. Hard drive space
  5. Portability

Criteria

Please provide your answers in the form below:
fields.description: Imagine that you're looking to buy a car for a young, suburban family. Please provide 4 to 8 things that you care about when looking for your new vehicle
fields.title: Come up with criteria for buying a new car

fields.body:
Collect one fact about the %(0)s of %(1)s

Imagine that you are researching the %(0)s of %(1)s. Please provide one piece of information about this topic.

Rules

  • Please write the piece of information in one complete sentence.
  • Please provide a reference URL for your info.

Example

For example, some facts about the portability of the Alienware - M17x laptop are:

  • It weighs 11.68 pounds and has a battery life of less than two hours, so it's not for those who value portability. -- http://www.consumersearch.com/laptops/alienware-m17x
  • Turning down the performance will allow you to squeeze another 30 minutes of life out of the battery, but even that isn't enough to compete with the battery power of comparable laptops -- http://www.associatedcontent.com/article/2193663/review_alienware_m17x_the_ultimate.html

Response

Information:

Reference URL:

fields.title: Collect one fact about the %(0)s of the %(1)s

fields.body:
Write a sentence out of some facts

Rules

  • Please write one complete sentence with good spelling and grammar.
  • Please pick at most 3 facts from the bullet points below to include your sentence

Example

For example, given the following facts:

  • it's really hard to start a new company
  • there are a variety of ways to fund a new company, but none of them really depend on the quality of the idea
  • many companies are funded by personal funds or family investments. this becomes a test of your relationships, or your personal savings
  • angel investors test how well you can deliver convincing pitches

you might merge them into a sentence as follows:

Rather than relying on the significance of their idea, many founders are forced rely on personal savings, friends and family to fund their company, which heavily taxes their personal life.

Sentence

Given the following facts:

    %(list)s

Please provide your combined sentence in the textarea below:
fields.description: Please write a sentence using the given facts
fields.title: Write a sentence using given facts

fields.body:
Vote on the best partition for an article on New York City

The Carnegie Mellon Social Computing Laboratory is conducting research to study how people write articles on the internet. The following is a list of outlines that have been proposed for writing articles online. Please vote on each of these partitions for quality.

Rules

  • Please rate each partition based on how well suited it is for an article on NYC.

Sentence

Given the following facts:

    %(partitions)s
fields.description: Rate outlines of an article on NYC
fields.title: Rate article outlines

fields.body:
Create an outline for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill

The Carnegie Mellon Social Computing Laboratory is conducting research to study how people write articles on the internet. Your job is to create an outline for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill.

Rules

When creating your outline, please try to maximize:
  • How well-written the article would be (ie. engaging, professional prose)
  • How comprehensive the article would be (ie. not missing any major details)
  • How neutral the article would be (ie. presenting views fairly)

Example

For example, an article on Lions might have the following outline:

  1. Biological classification
  2. Physical characteristics
  3. Biology and behavior
  4. Distribution and habitat
  5. Population and conservation status
  6. Cultural depictions

Your Outline
fields.description: Your job is to create an outline for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill.
fields.title: Create an outline for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill

fields.body:
Combine outlines for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill

The Carnegie Mellon Social Computing Laboratory is conducting research to study how people write articles on the internet. The following is a list of outlines that have been proposed for the basis of an article the Gulf of Mexico oil spill. Your job is to take these outlines as inspiration for creating a new partition.

Rules

When creating your outline, please try to maximize:
  • How well-written the article would be (ie. engaging, professional prose)
  • How comprehensive the article would be (ie. not missing any major details)
  • How neutral the article would be (ie. presenting views fairly)
Also note that you must use headings from existing outlines.

Outlines

%(partitions)s

Your Combined Outline
fields.description: Your job is to take these outlines as inspiration for creating a new partition.
fields.title: Combine outlines for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill

fields.body:
Vote on the best outline for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill

The Carnegie Mellon Social Computing Laboratory is conducting research to study how people write articles on the internet. The following is a list of outlines that have been proposed for the basis of an article the Gulf of Mexico oil spill. Imagine that an author was to write an article using one of these outlines. Your job is to decide which one of them you think will result in a better article.

Rules

When assigning ratings (1-awful, 5-excellent) to the given outlines, please keep these in mind:
  • How well-written the article would be based on the given outline (ie. engaging, professional prose)
  • How comprehensive the article would be (ie. not missing any major details)
  • How neutral the article would be (ie. presenting views fairly)

Outlines

%(partitions)s
fields.description: Your job is to decide which one of them you think will result in a better article.
fields.title: Vote on the best outline for an article on the Gulf of Mexico oil spill
